project_p7.meta.title: Nexus Platform — Victor de Alcântara Bueno
project_p7.meta.description: Ticket sales via WhatsApp with offline check-in and an admin panel.
project_p7.hero.title: Nexus Platform
project_p7.hero.subtitle: Ticketing platform with WhatsApp sales, integrated payments, and resilient check-in operations at events.
project_p7.hero.kpi: Main KPI: gate check-in operable without internet (offline-first + sync).
project_p7.hero.image_alt: WhatsApp purchase flow and admin dashboard
project_p7.hero.figure_caption: Snapshot: real screenshot of the flow and admin view.
project_p7.tldr.problem: sales and support depended on fragmented channels, and check-in failed when the network dropped at the gate.
project_p7.tldr.solution: a WhatsApp sales flow + a multi-tenant backend with integrations (WhatsApp Cloud API and Mercado Pago) + offline-first check-in with a local queue and synchronization.
project_p7.tldr.result: gate operations without internet with safe synchronization; fewer operational incidents on event day and a more predictable sales flow.
project_p7.tldr.note: Monorepo with backend, admin dashboards, and local infrastructure via Docker Compose (details in the README).
project_p7.snapshot.col2: Event operations across multiple organizations (multi-tenant), with a need for low friction and operational consistency.
project_p7.snapshot.col3: The gate may lose internet; external integrations require idempotency and traceability to avoid duplicates/errors.
project_p7.problem_impact.symptoms: sales/support depending on integrations, and the gate getting stuck when check-in required network.
project_p7.problem_impact.cause: no single sales flow and no offline-first mechanism with a queue and controlled retries for the critical operation.
project_p7.problem_impact.impact: high operational risk at the gate, inconsistencies from reprocessing, and increased support on event day.
project_p7.approach.step1: by integrating WhatsApp Cloud API and server-side orchestration per organization (multi-tenant).
project_p7.approach.step2: via Mercado Pago with admin routes for operations and support.
project_p7.approach.step3: (check-in and POS) with a local queue (IndexedDB) and batch synchronization to reduce spikes.
project_p7.stack.title: Stack
project_p7.reliability.risks: duplicates on resend (offline/retry), spikes on reconnect, and operational inconsistency across devices.
project_p7.reliability.guarantees: a local queue (IndexedDB) with retry and batch sync for POS; idempotency via externalId to avoid duplicated sales.
project_p7.reliability.evidence: a real snippet of the queue/sync mechanism (IndexedDB + POS batch sync).
project_p7.next.item1: Expand queue observability (pending, age, sync rate) to anticipate field failures.
project_p7.next.item2: Consolidate operational reports (check-in, POS, and reconciliation) to reduce support and speed up auditing.
project_p7.next.item3: Improve funnel metrics (WhatsApp → payment → issuance/validation) to identify bottlenecks by step.
project_p7.conversion.p: If you need low-friction sales and to operate in the field without relying on internet (gates, events, POS), I design an offline-first flow with idempotency, batch sync, and an audit trail.
